description: I can't find a way to relate the ID's as seen through the EC2 API to the ID's as seen on the filesystem, in logs, in libvirt, etc... This is quite annoying. I'm not super-fond of the idea of making the EC2 id the canonical one, but I have to say that seeing the EC2 ID in "virsh list", for instance, was /extremely/ convenient.
title: No way(?) to relate EC2 instance ID's to internal ID's.

comments.content: I can't find a way to relate the ID's as seen through the EC2 API to the ID's as seen on the filesystem, in logs, in libvirt, etc... This is quite annoying. I'm not super-fond of the idea of making the EC2 id the canonical one, but I have to say that seeing the EC2 ID in "virsh list", for instance, was /extremely/ convenient.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content: The current numbering seems to address this (i-00000008  == instance-00000008), so closing as FixCommitted, please reopen if there was more to it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
